what: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: rebib spun package texor project. decision based fact bibliography section texor package expanding significantly, enough package. Reads bib chunks produce close bibtex equivalent Separate title, URL field, year, ISBN (applicable) Rest data stored journal(internally) publisher(writing bibtex file) Ignores commented bibliography URL,ISBN,publisher,year optional fields enabled relevant

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: procedure meant debugging errors finding went wrong.
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") file_name <- rebib::get_texfile_name(wd) bib_items <- rebib::extract_embeded_bib_items(wd,file_name) # for debugging single entry rebib::bibliography_parser(bib_items[1]) # for multiple entries rebib::bib_handler(bib_items[1:2])

title: Convert LaTeX embedded bibliography to bibtex
text: Embedded bibliography : generated BibTeX :
code:
ibitem[R Core Team]{R} R Core Team 
ewblock R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing 
ewblock \emph{R Foundation for Statistical Computing}, Vienna, Austria \penalty0 2016. 
ewblock URL : \url{https://www.R-project.org/}, ISBN 3-900051-07-0 @book{R, author = {{R Core Team}}, title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria}, year = {2016}, url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, isbn = {3-900051-07-0} }

title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) #> [1] "No Bib files found !" #> [1] "will need to convert bbl to .bib" cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #> author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #> title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #> publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3: 299--314}, #> year = {1996}, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author = {{R Core Team}}, #> title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, #> publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria}, #> year = {2016}, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, #> isbn = {3-900051-07-0} #> }

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) #> [1] "Found Bib file  example.bib" #> [1] "\\bibliography{bib_file} exists!" bib_path <- paste(wd, "example.bib", sep = "/") references <- rebib::split_bibtex_references(bib_path) print(references) #> $types #> [1] "book" "book" #>  #> $names #> [1] "ihaka:1996" "R"          #>
